name: v0.34
body: - Adds support for the Sagemcom T210-D-r smart meter (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/110).

name: v0.33
body:
- Test Python 3.10 in CI + legacy badge fix (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/105).
- Update telegram_specifications.py (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/106).
- Improve compatiblity with Belgian standard (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/107).
- Improve documentation asyncio (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/63).

name: v0.32
body: - Support DSMR data read via RFXtrx with integrated P1 reader (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/98).

name: v0.31
body: - Support for (German) EasyMeter Q3D using COM-1 Ethernet Gateway (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/92).

name: v0.30
body: - Add support for Swedish smart meters (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/86).

name: v0.29
body:
- Add value and unit properties to ProfileGenericObject to make sure that code like iterators that rely on that do not break (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/71)).
- Remove deprecated asyncio coroutine decorator (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/76)).

name: v0.28
body:
- Optional keep alive monitoring for TCP/IP connections (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/73)).
- Catch parse errors in TelegramParser, ignore lines that can not be parsed (https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/74)).

name: v0.27
body: - fix for empty parentheses in ProfileGenericParser (redone) ([pr #69](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/69)).

name: v0.26
body: - revert fix for empty parentheses in ProfileGenericParser ([pr #68](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/68)).

name: v0.25
body: - fix for empty parentheses in ProfileGenericParser ([pr #57](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/57)).

name: v0.24
body: - Add Luxembourg equipment identifier ([pr #62](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/62)).

name: v0.23
body:
- Resolved issue with x-x:24.3.0 where it contains non-integer character ([pr #61](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/61)).
- Tests are not installed anymore ([pr #59](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/59)).
- Example telegram improvement ([pr #58](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/58)).

name: v0.22
body:
- Pass exception to log.exception as it is not called from within an exception ([pr #55](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/55)).
- Improve CRC speed ([pr #49](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/49)).

name: v0.21
body:
- All objects can produce a json serialization of their state. ([pr #54](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/54)).
- All objects can now print their values. ([pr #53](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/53)).
- Add parser + object for generic profile. ([pr #53](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/53)).

name: v0.18
body: - PyCRC replacement ([pr #48](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/48)).

name: v0.17
body: - Add a true telegram object ([pr #40](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/40)).

name: v0.16
body: - Add support for Belgian and Smarty meters ([pr #44](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/44)).

name: v0.15
body: - Fixed asyncio loop issue ([pr #43](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/43)).

name: v0.14
body: - Changed serial reading to reduce CPU usage ([pr #37](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/37)).

name: v0.13
body: - Fix DSMR v5.0 serial settings which were not used ([pr #33](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/33)).

name: v0.12
body:
- Add serial settings for DSMR v5.0 ([pr #31](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/31)). 
- Lux-creos-obis-1.8.0 ([pr #32](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/32)).

name: v0.11
body: - NULL value fix in checksum ([issue #26](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/issues/26))

name: v0.10
body:
- bugix: don't force full telegram signatures ([issue #25](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/issues/25))
- removed unused code for automatic telegram detection as this needs reworking after the fix mentioned above
- InvalidChecksumError's are logged as warning instead of error.

name: v0.9
body: - added DSMR v5 serial settings

name: v0.8
body:
- added support for DSMR v3
- added support for DSMR v5

**IMPORTANT: this release has the following backwards incompatible changes:**
- Removed TelegramParserV2_2 in favor of TelegramParser
- Removed TelegramParserV4 in favor of TelegramParser

name: v0.7
body:
- Internal refactoring related to the way clients feed their data into the parse module. Clients can now supply the telegram data in single characters, lines (which was common) or complete telegram strings ([issue #17](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/issues/17)). 

**IMPORTANT: this release has the following backwards incompatible changes:**
- Client related imports from dsmr_parser.serial and dsmr_parser.protocol have been moved to dsmr_parser.clients (import these from the `clients/__init__.py` module)
- The `.parse()` method of `TelegramParser`, `TelegramParserV2_2`, `TelegramParserV4` now accepts a string containing the entire telegram (including \r\n characters) and not a list

name: v0.6
body:
- Fixed bug in CRC checksum verification for the asyncio client ([pull request #15](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/15))
- Support added for TCP connections using the asyncio client ([pull request #12](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/12/))
- CRC checksum verification for DSMR v4 telegrams ([issue #10](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/issues/10))

name: v0.4
body:
- DSMR v2.2 serial settings now uses parity serial.EVEN by default ([pull request #5](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/5))
- improved asyncio reader and improve it's error handling ([pull request #8](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/8))

name: v0.3
body: - asyncio reader for non-blocking reads ([pull request #3](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/3))

name: v0.2
body: - support for DMSR version 2.2 ([pull request #2](https://github.com/ndokter/dsmr_parser/pull/2))

name: v0.1
body: - initial version with a serial reader and support for DSMR version 4.x
